subscription_alternative.monthly_limit: Up to 5x more usage limits on GPT-4o compared to the free tier, with access to GPT-4o, GPT-4 Turbo, and advanced tools like DALL-E 3, Advanced Data Analysis, and web browsing.
5x more usage than the free tier, with a higher cap for interacting with Claude 3.5 Sonnet.

claude_3_haiku.subscription_alternative: Available via free and Pro tiers

subscription_alternative.monthly_limit: Part of Google One AI Premium, includes access to Gemini 1.5 Pro, 1.5 Flash, and 1.0 Ultra.

gemini_1_5_flash.subscription_alternative: Available via free and Advanced subscriptions

llama_3_1_405b_instruct.notes: Open-source model. Pricing is based on managed service APIs like those from Together AI, Databricks, or Google Cloud Vertex AI. Price shown is a representative market rate.

llama_3_1_70b_instruct.notes: Open-source model. Pricing is based on managed service APIs. Price shown is a representative market rate.

copilot_pro.description: For individuals, provides priority access to latest models (GPT-4 Turbo), during peak times, faster performance, and capabilities in Microsoft 365 apps (Word, Excel, etc.).

microsoft_365_copilot.description: For enterprise/organizations, integrates deeply into Microsoft 365 apps (Teams, Outlook, etc.) with enterprise-grade data protection and customization.

copilot_free.description: Basic web-based access, powered by GPT-4 and DALL-E 3, with usage throttling during peak hours.

deepseek_v2.notes: Highly competitive pricing from a Chinese AI lab, focusing on large context windows and bilingual capabilities.

qwen2_72b_instruct.notes: Alibaba's flagship model, offered via Alibaba Cloud PAI and ModelScope. Strong multilingual performance, particularly in Asian languages.

pricing_analysis.subscription_adoption_rate: High and growing rapidly, driven by consumer products like ChatGPT Plus, Claude Pro, and Gemini Advanced. Enterprise adoption is moving towards flat-rate seat licenses (e.g., Microsoft 365 Copilot) alongside API consumption.
pricing_analysis.trend: The market is experiencing a significant price war, driving down the cost per token, especially for high-volume, lower-complexity models (e.g., Gemini Flash, Claude Haiku). There's a clear bifurcation: frontier models (GPT-4o, Claude 3.5 Sonnet) command premium prices, while highly efficient, smaller models offer extreme cost-effectiveness for specific tasks. Subscriptions are becoming the dominant model for consumer access, bundling various models and tools for a flat monthly fee.
